methods: New algorithm for smooth strongly convex minimization
results: Computational complexity improvement compared to existing methods
title: An Optimal Algorithm for Strongly Convex Min-min Optimization
abstract:
In this paper we study the smooth strongly convex minimization problem $\min_{x}\min_y f(x,y)$. The existing optimal first-order methods require $\mathcal{O}(\sqrt{\max\{\kappa_x,\kappa_y\}} \log 1/\epsilon)$ of computations of both $
abla_x f(x,y)$ and $
abla_y f(x,y)$, where $\kappa_x$ and $\kappa_y$ are condition numbers with respect to variable blocks $x$ and $y$. We propose a new algorithm that only requires $\mathcal{O}(\sqrt{\kappa_x} \log 1/\epsilon)$ of computations of $
abla_x f(x,y)$ and $\mathcal{O}(\sqrt{\kappa_y} \log 1/\epsilon)$ computations of $
abla_y f(x,y)$. In some applications $\kappa_x \gg \kappa_y$, and computation of $
abla_y f(x,y)$ is significantly cheaper than computation of $
abla_x f(x,y)$. In this case, our algorithm substantially outperforms the existing state-of-the-art methods.
